comments:
The situation is the use of the xml multipage editor of the webtools 
platform. The files are in xml format but with another extension (e.g. 
".abc"). To open these files in the xml editor there is created a 
relation between the org.eclipse.core.runtime.xml content-type and my file 
extension ".abc".This extension point definition is used:

<extension
   point="org.eclipse.core.contenttype.contentTypes">

    <file-association

          content-type="org.eclipse.core.runtime.xml"

          file-extensions="abc">

    </file-association>

</extension>

The problem is that the editor only accepts ".ABC" files and no ".abc" files. 
Even if "abc" and "ABC" is put in the file-extension attribute of the 
extension point, the editor throws Unsupported Content Type Error when 
opening ".abc" files.
Could you please post the stack trace of when the Unsupported Content Type Error is thrown?
It sounds like a dialog our XML Editor throws up when the input is not a supported content type.  Carsten, what's allowing it to open .ABC files?

2. I don?t know what is allowing to open .ABC files. It seems to do automatically. This is one of the things which forced me to open this bug.

Carsten, can you add your configuration details to this bug?  Is there anything else installed for editing "*.abc" or "*.ABC" files?  Which version of WTP were you using and what are the steps you're using to open the file (menus, actions, etc.)?

- There is another, self-made editor which is related to *.abc files by the org.eclipse.ui.editors extension-point

- The plugin containing the editor I?m using is org.eclipse.wst.xml.ui (1.0.201.v200702021717)

- To open the editor, I use a self-made piece of code. This code contains the IWorkbenchPage.openEditor(IEditorInput input,String editorId,boolean activate,int matchFlags) method. The editor input is an instance of FileEditorInput.class

- My configuration details:

see attachment in Comment#5

I recognize that stack trace in comment #3.  It was fixed in WTP 2.0.  See bug #177304 for more information.

That only fixes the NPE though.  It doesn't fix why the file extension is not recognized as an xml content type which is what you need to use all the features of the XML editor.
